caption:
This photograph depicts three men walking along a road in what appears to be an industrial or factory setting. The men, likely workers, are dressed in casual, rugged work attire including jeans and boots. Each carries a lunch box, suggesting they are either heading to or returning from a shift. They are walking in a line, with the man in the center slightly ahead, engaged in seemingly relaxed conversation or in middle of a casual moment.

In the background, the building has a prominent sign that reads "GEORGIA PACIFIC," indicating the location could be a facility operated by the Georgia-Pacific company, which is known for manufacturing paper, pulp, and building products. The architecture includes a brick building with a small dome structure on the corner, alongside other industrial structure elements in varying colors including red and green.

The setting conveys a typical day at an industrial job site, with a focus on the workers in a moment of transition between work and break. The environment is utilitarian with a "WASTE" container visible at the right side of the frame, adding to the industrial feel of the scene. The overall composition encapsulates a slice of everyday work life in a mid-to-late 20th century industrial American setting.
title: 4 p.m. - end of a work shift at Georgia Pacific Paper Company in Woodland
